word: If the work of temperance were carried forward by us as it was begun thirty years ago; [FIRST PUBLISHED IN 1900.] if at our camp meetings we presented before the people the evils of intemperance in eating and drinking, and especially the evil of liquor drinking; if these things were presented in connection with the evidences of Christ's soon coming, there would be a shaking among the people. If we showed a zeal in proportion to the importance of the truths we are handling, we might be instrumental in rescuing hundreds, yea thousands, from ruin.-- Testimonies, vol. 6. p. 111.
